## Useful Info

**Rakshasas** are [demonic](/Demonic "Demonic") illusionists that wield [whips](/Whip "Whip") and spawn multiple decoys of themselves and any monsters in their [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight"). These decoys are every bit as dangerous as the original, but all decoys will disappear when the original is slain. Also, when reduced to 50% HP, they will occasionally create two duplicates instantly. They are a common sight in [the Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"), [the Abyss](/The_Abyss "The Abyss"), and [Lom Lobon](/Lom_Lobon "Lom Lobon")'s realm in [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium") - but may show up as early as D:8.

| Slot2       | [Phantom Mirror](/Phantom_Mirror_\(spell\) "Phantom Mirror (spell)") | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Blink](/Blink "Blink")                                              | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Thanks to Force Lance, their ranged damage output is significant, especially to lightly armoured characters; even heavily armoured characters can be knocked out of an advantageous choke point. If you're uncomfortable facing a single rakshasa, flee before it duplicates and makes itself even deadlier.

## History

- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), rakshasas had [Iskenderun's Mystic Blast](/Iskenderun%27s_Mystic_Blast "Iskenderun's Mystic Blast") instead of [Force Lance](/Force_Lance "Force Lance").
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), they knew [Blink](/Blink "Blink"), [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility"), [Teleport Self](/Teleport_Self "Teleport Self"), and the much-less-deadly [Rakshasa Summon](/Rakshasa_Summon "Rakshasa Summon") in place of their current spellset.

A demon in the form of a tiger who comes to the material world in search of power and knowledge. Rakshasas are experts in the art of illusion, and are simultaneously intelligent and cruel.

“Vaisampayana said, 'Not far from the place where the Pandavas were asleep, a Rakshasa by name Hidimva dwelt on the Sala tree. Possessed of great energy and prowess, he was a cruel cannibal of visage that was grim in consequence of his sharp and long teeth. He was now hungry and longing for human flesh. Of long shanks and a large belly, his locks and beard were both red in hue. His shoulders were broad like the neck of a tree; his ears were like unto arrows, and his features were frightful.”
-_Mahābhārata_, Adi Parva, Hidimva-vadha Parva, section CLIV. ca. 500 B.C.
trans. Kisari Mohan Ganguli, 1883.

Useful Info

Rakshasas are demonic illusionists that wield whips and spawn multiple decoys of themselves and any monsters in their line of sight. These decoys are every bit as dangerous as the original, but all decoys will disappear when the original is slain. Also, when reduced to 50% HP, they will occasionally create two duplicates instantly. They are a common sight in the Depths, the Abyss, and Lom Lobon's realm in Pandemonium - but may show up as early as D:8.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Force Lance (3d14) Magical flag
Slot2 Phantom Mirror Magical flag
Slot3 Blink Magical flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Thanks to Force Lance, their ranged damage output is significant, especially to lightly armoured characters; even heavily armoured characters can be knocked out of an advantageous choke point. If you're uncomfortable facing a single rakshasa, flee before it duplicates and makes itself even deadlier.

History

  • Prior to 0.25, rakshasas had Iskenderun's Mystic Blast instead of Force Lance.
  • Prior to 0.14, they knew Blink, Invisibility, Teleport Self, and the much-less-deadly Rakshasa Summon in place of their current spellset.
